Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the fabric is partially light-brown in section, the interior is slightly grooved and bears traces of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394797) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394797)
